intro: Anthemis callieri, commonly known as the Sierra Madre tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers with a strong, often unpleasant odor, which is typical of the genus Anthemis. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, Anthemis callieri is considered a rare and endemic species.
